definition: to untie/to free/to absolve of/to get free of/to extirpate oneself/(Buddhism) to free oneself of worldly worries
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.chinese: 她使自己從煩惱中解脫出來。

sentences.english: Disentangle the person's feet from the wreckage and bring the feet foward to exit.
sentences.chinese: 將傷者的腳從殘骸中解脫出來，並移至靠近出口處。

sentences.english: Nirvana brings the joy of liberation.
Absence from those we love is self from self a deadly banishment.
sentences.chinese: 脫離情人就是自我解脫，極度地放縱。

sentences.english: Liberation and awakened understanding can’t be found by devoting ourselves to the study of the Buddhist scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 解脫和覺醒無法從鑽研佛經中獲得。

sentences.english: He cut desperately at the rope in an attempt to free his foot.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命砍繩子，試圖把自己的腳解脫開。

sentences.english: Maharaj: What do you mean by realisation and liberation?
sentences.chinese: 你所說的開悟和解脫是什麼意思？

sentences.english: We want you to begin reaching for that ensuing sense of relief.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望你能夠體會得到那種解脫後的輕鬆感。

sentences.english: Soldiers would find that a welcome relief.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們會發現他們從笨重的防護服中終得解脫。

sentences.english: But now, I can see that this is liberating.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在，我開始懂了，這是一種解脫。

sentences.english: Advocating free soul, Yebao such as reincarnation and non-violence.
sentences.chinese: 主張靈魂解脫，業報輪迴和非暴力等。

sentences.english: Chapter III is about the freedom from the material pressure.
sentences.chinese: 第三章從物質環境壓力的解脫談起。

sentences.english: In one of right knowledge, right release comes into being.
sentences.chinese: 有正智的人，正解脫產生。

sentences.english: Perhaps he knew that, own iscaught instead is in kind of spiritual extricating.
sentences.chinese: 或許他知道，自己的落網反而是種精神上的解脫。

sentences.english: As your birthday month gets under way, you’ll feel a great sense of relief.
sentences.chinese: 隨着蠍子們誕辰月的啓動，你會感到一種解脫。

sentences.english: You have to get up and take breaks from sitting.
sentences.chinese: 帕特說“你需要站起來從久坐中解脫出來。”

definition: to be worried/to be distressed/worries
all living things
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
to confess/to repent/remorse/repentance/penitent/confession (Buddhism)
to come to understand/to realize/consciousness/awareness/Buddhist enlightenment (Sanskrit: cittotpāda)
to separate
vexed/distressed
to be frightened/fear/dread
pain (from wound)/sorrow
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
happy/joyous/delighted/to like/to be fond of
